snippet: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt.
abstract: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt;  most of them did well enough through midlife to take on sizable loans, but some have since fallen on tough times because of the recession, health problems,  or job losses, and are too ashamed to seek assistance; borrowers age 60 and older are the fastest-growing age group for college debt in the nation (Series: Degrees of Debt).
lead_paragraph: Millions of parents who have taken out loans to pay for their children’s college education make up a less visible generation in debt.

headline.print_headline: Child’s Education, but Parents’ Crushing Loans
